name: Is this an ad?
description: Unsolicited NFT art placed in the ownership of Tez addresses found on the front page of Objkt.com. Imagine if this was porn or something ruinous of a reputation. “Is this an ad?” predicts a time when NFT spam will become the same nuisance that spam email is. How can we prevent this? Option 1: NFT transfers can require a confirmation from the receiver. Option 2: Wallets or marketplaces can have NFTs undisplayed by default and the owner has to opt into showing their pieces. Option 3: We create a blacklist of addresses known to spam (warning: this is a centralized option that can be abused and used for censorship.) First sent to mikeshinoda.tez, caesuras.tez, pronoia.tez, zancan.tez, matthias.tez, rizen.tez, bobbysmolz.tez, jefff.tez, kohtza.tez, whatisreal.tez, and john karel of randomly common skeles.
